item.title: Authentification Development Details
item.description: Developer Architecture Notes Authentication Architecture Polaris separates authentication into two logical phases using Quarkus Security: Credential extraction – parsing headers and tokens Credential authentication – validating identity and assigning roles Key Interfaces Authenticator: A core interface used to authenticate credentials and resolve principal and principal roles. Roles may be derived from OIDC claims or internal mappings. InternalPolarisToken: Used in internal auth and inherits from PrincipalCredential. The DefaultAuthenticator is used to implement realm-specific logic based on these abstractions.
